trans-unit.source: Application Insights API for custom events and metrics
trans-unit.target: Application Insights API for custom events and metrics

trans-unit.source: Insert a few lines of code in your device or desktop app, web page or service, to track usage and diagnose issues.
trans-unit.target: Insert a few lines of code in your device or desktop app, web page or service, to track usage and diagnose issues.

trans-unit.source: Application Insights API for custom events and metrics
trans-unit.target: Application Insights API for custom events and metrics

trans-unit.source: Application Insights is in preview.
trans-unit.target: Application Insights is in preview.

trans-unit.source: Insert a few lines of code in your application to find out what users are doing with it, or to help diagnose issues.
trans-unit.target: Insert a few lines of code in your application to find out what users are doing with it, or to help diagnose issues.

trans-unit.source: You can send telemetry from device and desktop apps, web clients, and web servers.
trans-unit.target: You can send telemetry from device and desktop apps, web clients, and web servers.

trans-unit.source: The Application Insights data collectors use this API to send standard telemetry such as page views and exception reports, but you can also use it to send your own custom telemetry.
trans-unit.target: The Application Insights data collectors use this API to send standard telemetry such as page views and exception reports, but you can also use it to send your own custom telemetry.

trans-unit.source: API summary
trans-unit.target: API summary

trans-unit.source: The API is uniform across all platforms, apart from a few small variations.
trans-unit.target: The API is uniform across all platforms, apart from a few small variations.

trans-unit.source: Method
trans-unit.target: Method

trans-unit.source: Used for
trans-unit.target: Used for

trans-unit.source: Pages, screens, blades or forms
trans-unit.target: Pages, screens, blades or forms

trans-unit.source: User actions and other events.
trans-unit.target: User actions and other events.

trans-unit.source: Used to track user behavior or to monitor performance.
trans-unit.target: Used to track user behavior or to monitor performance.

trans-unit.source: Performance measurements such as queue lengths not related to specific events
trans-unit.target: Performance measurements such as queue lengths not related to specific events

trans-unit.source: Log exceptions for diagnosis.
trans-unit.target: Log exceptions for diagnosis.

trans-unit.source: Trace where they occur in relation to other events and examine stack traces.
trans-unit.target: Trace where they occur in relation to other events and examine stack traces.

trans-unit.source: Log the frequency and duration of server requests for performance analysis.
trans-unit.target: Log the frequency and duration of server requests for performance analysis.

trans-unit.source: Diagnostic log messages.
trans-unit.target: Diagnostic log messages.

trans-unit.source: You can also capture 3rd-party logs.
trans-unit.target: You can also capture 3rd-party logs.

trans-unit.source: Log the duration and frequency of calls to external components on which your app depends.
trans-unit.target: Log the duration and frequency of calls to external components on which your app depends.

trans-unit.source: You can [attach properties and metrics](#properties) to most of these telemetry calls.
trans-unit.target: You can [attach properties and metrics](#properties) to most of these telemetry calls.

trans-unit.source: Before you start
trans-unit.target: Before you start

trans-unit.source: If you haven't done these yet:
trans-unit.target: If you haven't done these yet:

trans-unit.source: Add the Application Insights SDK to your project:
trans-unit.target: Add the Application Insights SDK to your project:

trans-unit.source: [ASP.NET project][greenbrown]
trans-unit.target: [ASP.NET project][greenbrown]

trans-unit.source: [Windows project][windows]
trans-unit.target: [Windows project][windows]

trans-unit.source: [Java project][java]
trans-unit.target: [Java project][java]

trans-unit.source: [JavaScript in each web page][client]
trans-unit.target: [JavaScript in each web page][client]

trans-unit.source: In your device or web server code, include:
trans-unit.target: In your device or web server code, include:

trans-unit.source: *C#:* `using Microsoft.ApplicationInsights;`
trans-unit.target: *C#:* `using Microsoft.ApplicationInsights;`

trans-unit.source: *VB:* `Imports Microsoft.ApplicationInsights`
trans-unit.target: *VB:* `Imports Microsoft.ApplicationInsights`

trans-unit.source: *Java:* `import com.microsoft.applicationinsights.TelemetryClient;`
trans-unit.target: *Java:* `import com.microsoft.applicationinsights.TelemetryClient;`

trans-unit.source: Construct a TelemetryClient
trans-unit.target: Construct a TelemetryClient

trans-unit.source: Construct an instance of TelemetryClient (except in JavaScript in web pages):
trans-unit.target: Construct an instance of TelemetryClient (except in JavaScript in web pages):

trans-unit.source: VB:
trans-unit.target: VB:

trans-unit.source: Java
trans-unit.target: Java

trans-unit.source: We recommend you use one instance of `TelemetryClient` for each request in a web app, or for each session in other apps.
trans-unit.target: We recommend you use one instance of `TelemetryClient` for each request in a web app, or for each session in other apps.

trans-unit.source: You can set properties such as `TelemetryClient.Context.User.Id` to track users and sessions.
trans-unit.target: You can set properties such as `TelemetryClient.Context.User.Id` to track users and sessions.

trans-unit.source: This information is attached to all events sent by the instance.
trans-unit.target: This information is attached to all events sent by the instance.

trans-unit.source: TelemetryClient is thread-safe.
trans-unit.target: TelemetryClient is thread-safe.

trans-unit.source: Track Event
trans-unit.target: Track Event

trans-unit.source: Events can be displayed in [Metrics Explorer][metrics] as an aggregated count, and you can also display individual occurrences in [Diagnostic Search][diagnostic].
trans-unit.target: Events can be displayed in [Metrics Explorer][metrics] as an aggregated count, and you can also display individual occurrences in [Diagnostic Search][diagnostic].

trans-unit.source: Insert events in your code to count how often they use a particular feature, how often they achieve particular goals, or make particular choices.
trans-unit.target: Insert events in your code to count how often they use a particular feature, how often they achieve particular goals, or make particular choices.

trans-unit.source: For example, in a game app, send an event whenever a user wins the game:
trans-unit.target: For example, in a game app, send an event whenever a user wins the game:

trans-unit.source: JavaScript
trans-unit.target: JavaScript

trans-unit.source: C
trans-unit.target: C

trans-unit.source: VB
trans-unit.target: VB

trans-unit.source: Java
trans-unit.target: Java

trans-unit.source: Click the Custom Events tile on the overview blade:
trans-unit.target: Click the Custom Events tile on the overview blade:

trans-unit.source: Browse to your application resource in portal.azure.com
trans-unit.target: Browse to your application resource in portal.azure.com

trans-unit.source: Click through to see an overview chart and a complete list.
trans-unit.target: Click through to see an overview chart and a complete list.

trans-unit.source: Select the chart and group it by Event name to see the relative contributions of the most significant events.
trans-unit.target: Select the chart and group it by Event name to see the relative contributions of the most significant events.

trans-unit.source: Select the chart and set Grouping
trans-unit.target: Select the chart and set Grouping

trans-unit.source: From the list below the chart, select an event name.
trans-unit.target: From the list below the chart, select an event name.

trans-unit.source: Click through to see individual occurrences of the event.
trans-unit.target: Click through to see individual occurrences of the event.

trans-unit.source: Drill through the events
trans-unit.target: Drill through the events

trans-unit.source: Click any occurrence to see more detail.
trans-unit.target: Click any occurrence to see more detail.

trans-unit.source: Filter, search and segment your data with properties
trans-unit.target: Filter, search and segment your data with properties

trans-unit.source: You can attach properties and measurements to your events (and also to metrics, page views, exceptions, and other telemetry data).
trans-unit.target: You can attach properties and measurements to your events (and also to metrics, page views, exceptions, and other telemetry data).

trans-unit.source: **Properties** are string values that you can use to filter your telemetry in the usage reports.
trans-unit.target: **Properties** are string values that you can use to filter your telemetry in the usage reports.

trans-unit.source: For example if your app provides several games, you'll want to attach the name of the game to each event, so that you can see which games are more popular.
trans-unit.target: For example if your app provides several games, you'll want to attach the name of the game to each event, so that you can see which games are more popular.

trans-unit.source: There's a limit of about 1k on the string length.
trans-unit.target: There's a limit of about 1k on the string length.

trans-unit.source: (If you want to send large chunks of data, use the message parameter of [TrackTrace](#track-trace).)
trans-unit.target: (If you want to send large chunks of data, use the message parameter of [TrackTrace](#track-trace).)

trans-unit.source: **Metrics** are numeric values that can be presented graphically.
trans-unit.target: **Metrics** are numeric values that can be presented graphically.

trans-unit.source: For example, you might want to see if there's a gradual increase in the scores your gamers achieve.
trans-unit.target: For example, you might want to see if there's a gradual increase in the scores your gamers achieve.

trans-unit.source: The graphs can be segmented by the properties sent with the event, so that you could get separate or stacked graphs for different games.
trans-unit.target: The graphs can be segmented by the properties sent with the event, so that you could get separate or stacked graphs for different games.

trans-unit.source: Metric values should be >= 0 to be correctly displayed.
trans-unit.target: Metric values should be >= 0 to be correctly displayed.

trans-unit.source: There are some [limits on the number of properties, property values, and metrics](#limits) that you can use.
trans-unit.target: There are some [limits on the number of properties, property values, and metrics](#limits) that you can use.

trans-unit.target: JavaScript

trans-unit.source: C
trans-unit.target: C

trans-unit.target: VB

trans-unit.source: Java
trans-unit.target: Java

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE] Take care not to log personally identifiable information in properties.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE] Take care not to log personally identifiable information in properties.

trans-unit.source: **If you used metrics**, open Metric Explorer and select the metric from the Custom group:
trans-unit.target: **If you used metrics**, open Metric Explorer and select the metric from the Custom group:

trans-unit.target: Open metric explorer, select the chart, and select the metric

trans-unit.source: If your metric doesn't appear, close the selection blade, wait a while, and click Refresh.
trans-unit.target: If your metric doesn't appear, close the selection blade, wait a while, and click Refresh.

trans-unit.source: **If you used properties and metrics**, segment the metric by the property:
trans-unit.target: **If you used properties and metrics**, segment the metric by the property:

trans-unit.source: Set Grouping, then select the property under Group by
trans-unit.target: Set Grouping, then select the property under Group by

trans-unit.source: **In Diagnostic Search**, you can view the properties and metrics of individual occurrences of an event.
trans-unit.target: **In Diagnostic Search**, you can view the properties and metrics of individual occurrences of an event.

trans-unit.source: Select an instance, then select '...'
trans-unit.target: Select an instance, then select '...'

trans-unit.source: Use the Search field to see event occurrences with a particular property value.
trans-unit.target: Use the Search field to see event occurrences with a particular property value.

trans-unit.source: Type a term into Search
trans-unit.target: Type a term into Search

trans-unit.source: [Learn more about search expressions][diagnostic].
trans-unit.target: [Learn more about search expressions][diagnostic].

trans-unit.target: Alternative way to set properties and metrics

trans-unit.target: If it's more convenient, you can collect the parameters of an event in a separate object:

trans-unit.source: Timing events
trans-unit.target: Timing events

trans-unit.source: Sometimes you'd like to chart how long it takes to perform some action.
trans-unit.target: Sometimes you'd like to chart how long it takes to perform some action.

trans-unit.source: For example, you might like to know how long users take to consider choices in a game.
trans-unit.target: For example, you might like to know how long users take to consider choices in a game.

trans-unit.source: This is a useful example of uses of the measurement parameter.
trans-unit.target: This is a useful example of uses of the measurement parameter.

trans-unit.source: C
trans-unit.target: C

trans-unit.source: Track Metric
trans-unit.target: Track Metric

trans-unit.source: Use TrackMetric to send metrics that are not attached to particular events.
trans-unit.target: Use TrackMetric to send metrics that are not attached to particular events.

trans-unit.source: For example, you could monitor a queue length at regular intervals.
trans-unit.target: For example, you could monitor a queue length at regular intervals.

trans-unit.source: Metrics are displayed as statistical charts in metric explorer, but unlike events, you can't search for individual occurrences in diagnostic search.
trans-unit.target: Metrics are displayed as statistical charts in metric explorer, but unlike events, you can't search for individual occurrences in diagnostic search.

trans-unit.source: Metric values should be >= 0 to be correctly displayed.
trans-unit.target: Metric values should be >= 0 to be correctly displayed.

trans-unit.target: C

trans-unit.source: To see the results, open Metrics Explorer and add a new chart.
trans-unit.target: To see the results, open Metrics Explorer and add a new chart.

trans-unit.source: Set it to display your metric.
trans-unit.target: Set it to display your metric.

trans-unit.source: Add a new chart or select a chart, and under Custom select your metric
trans-unit.target: Add a new chart or select a chart, and under Custom select your metric

trans-unit.source: There are some [limits on the number of metrics](#limits) you can use.
trans-unit.target: There are some [limits on the number of metrics](#limits) you can use.

trans-unit.source: Page views
trans-unit.target: Page views

trans-unit.source: In a device or web page app, page view telemetry is sent by default when each screen or page is loaded.
trans-unit.target: In a device or web page app, page view telemetry is sent by default when each screen or page is loaded.

trans-unit.source: But you can change that to track page views at additional or different times.
trans-unit.target: But you can change that to track page views at additional or different times.

trans-unit.source: For example, in an app that displays tabs or blades, you might want to track a "page" whenever the user opens a new blade.
trans-unit.target: For example, in an app that displays tabs or blades, you might want to track a "page" whenever the user opens a new blade.

trans-unit.source: Usage lens on Overview blade
trans-unit.target: Usage lens on Overview blade

trans-unit.source: User and session data is sent as properties along with page views, so the user and session charts come alive when there is page view telemetry.
trans-unit.target: User and session data is sent as properties along with page views, so the user and session charts come alive when there is page view telemetry.

trans-unit.source: Custom page views
trans-unit.target: Custom page views

trans-unit.target: JavaScript

trans-unit.target: C

trans-unit.target: If you have several tabs within different HTML pages, you can specify the URL too:

trans-unit.source: Track Request
trans-unit.target: Track Request

trans-unit.source: Used by the server SDK to log HTTP requests.
trans-unit.target: Used by the server SDK to log HTTP requests.

trans-unit.source: You can also call it yourself if you want to simulate requests in a context where you don't have the web service module running.
trans-unit.target: You can also call it yourself if you want to simulate requests in a context where you don't have the web service module running.

trans-unit.source: C
trans-unit.target: C

trans-unit.source: Track Exception
trans-unit.target: Track Exception

trans-unit.source: Send exceptions to Application Insights: to [count them][metrics], as an indication of the frequency of a problem; and to [examine individual occurrences][diagnostic].
trans-unit.target: Send exceptions to Application Insights: to [count them][metrics], as an indication of the frequency of a problem; and to [examine individual occurrences][diagnostic].

trans-unit.source: The reports include the stack traces.
trans-unit.target: The reports include the stack traces.

trans-unit.source: C
trans-unit.target: C

trans-unit.source: JavaScript
trans-unit.target: JavaScript

trans-unit.source: The SDKs catch many exceptions automatically, so you don't always have to call TrackException explicitly.
trans-unit.target: The SDKs catch many exceptions automatically, so you don't always have to call TrackException explicitly.

trans-unit.source: ASP.NET: [Write code to catch exceptions](app-insights-asp-net-exceptions.md)
trans-unit.target: ASP.NET: [Write code to catch exceptions](app-insights-asp-net-exceptions.md)

trans-unit.source: J2EE: [Exceptions are caught automatically](app-insights-java-get-started.md#exceptions-and-request-failures)
trans-unit.target: J2EE: [Exceptions are caught automatically](app-insights-java-get-started.md#exceptions-and-request-failures)

trans-unit.source: Windows apps: [Crashes are caught automatically](app-insights-windows-crashes.md)
trans-unit.target: Windows apps: [Crashes are caught automatically](app-insights-windows-crashes.md)

trans-unit.source: JavaScript: Caught automatically.
trans-unit.target: JavaScript: Caught automatically.

trans-unit.source: If you want to disable automatic collection, add a line into the code snippet that you insert in your web pages:
trans-unit.target: If you want to disable automatic collection, add a line into the code snippet that you insert in your web pages:

trans-unit.source: Track Trace
trans-unit.target: Track Trace

trans-unit.source: Use this to help diagnose problems by sending a 'breadcrumb trail' to Application Insights.
trans-unit.target: Use this to help diagnose problems by sending a 'breadcrumb trail' to Application Insights.

trans-unit.source: You can send chunks of diagnostic data, and inspect them in [Diagnostic search][diagnostic].
trans-unit.target: You can send chunks of diagnostic data, and inspect them in [Diagnostic search][diagnostic].

trans-unit.source: [Log adapters][trace] use this API to send third-party logs to the portal.
trans-unit.target: [Log adapters][trace] use this API to send third-party logs to the portal.

trans-unit.source: C
trans-unit.target: C

trans-unit.source: The size limit on `message` is much higher than limit on properties.
trans-unit.target: The size limit on `message` is much higher than limit on properties.

trans-unit.source: You can search on message content, but (unlike property values) you can't filter on it.
trans-unit.target: You can search on message content, but (unlike property values) you can't filter on it.

trans-unit.source: Track Dependency
trans-unit.target: Track Dependency

trans-unit.source: Use this call to track the response times and success rates of calls to an external piece of code.
trans-unit.target: Use this call to track the response times and success rates of calls to an external piece of code.

trans-unit.source: The results appear in the dependency charts in the portal.
trans-unit.target: The results appear in the dependency charts in the portal.

trans-unit.source: Remember that the server SDKs include a [dependency module](app-insights-dependencies.md) that discovers and tracks certain dependency calls automatically - for example to databases and REST APIs.
trans-unit.target: Remember that the server SDKs include a [dependency module](app-insights-dependencies.md) that discovers and tracks certain dependency calls automatically - for example to databases and REST APIs.

trans-unit.source: You have to install an agent on your server to make the module work.
trans-unit.target: You have to install an agent on your server to make the module work.

trans-unit.source: You'd use this call if you want to track calls that aren't caught by the automated tracking, or if you don't want to install the agent.
trans-unit.target: You'd use this call if you want to track calls that aren't caught by the automated tracking, or if you don't want to install the agent.

trans-unit.source: To turn off the standard dependency tracking module, edit [ApplicationInsights.config](app-insights-configuration-with-applicationinsights-config.md) and delete the reference to `DependencyCollector.DependencyTrackingTelemetryModule`.
trans-unit.target: To turn off the standard dependency tracking module, edit [ApplicationInsights.config](app-insights-configuration-with-applicationinsights-config.md) and delete the reference to `DependencyCollector.DependencyTrackingTelemetryModule`.

trans-unit.source: Authenticated users
trans-unit.target: Authenticated users

trans-unit.source: In a web app, users are by default identified by cookie.
trans-unit.target: In a web app, users are by default identified by cookie.

trans-unit.source: A user might be counted more than once if they access your app from a different machine or browser, or delete cookies.
trans-unit.target: A user might be counted more than once if they access your app from a different machine or browser, or delete cookies.

trans-unit.source: But if users sign in to your app, you can get a more accurate count by setting the authenticated user id in the browser code:
trans-unit.target: But if users sign in to your app, you can get a more accurate count by setting the authenticated user id in the browser code:

trans-unit.source: JavaScript
trans-unit.target: JavaScript

trans-unit.source: It isn't necessary to use the user's actual sign-in name.
trans-unit.target: It isn't necessary to use the user's actual sign-in name.

trans-unit.source: It only has to be an id that is unique to that user.
trans-unit.target: It only has to be an id that is unique to that user.

trans-unit.source: It must not include spaces, or any of the characters `,;=|`.
trans-unit.target: It must not include spaces, or any of the characters `,;=|`.

trans-unit.source: The user id is also set in a session cookie and sent to the server.
trans-unit.target: The user id is also set in a session cookie and sent to the server.

trans-unit.source: If the server SDK is installed, the authenticated user id will be sent as part of the context properties of both client and server telemetry, so that you can filter and search on it.
trans-unit.target: If the server SDK is installed, the authenticated user id will be sent as part of the context properties of both client and server telemetry, so that you can filter and search on it.

trans-unit.source: If your app groups users into accounts, you can also pass an identifier for the account (with the same character restrictions).
trans-unit.target: If your app groups users into accounts, you can also pass an identifier for the account (with the same character restrictions).

trans-unit.source: In [metrics explorer](app-insights-metrics-explorer.md), you can create a chart of **Authenticated Users** and **Accounts**.
trans-unit.target: In [metrics explorer](app-insights-metrics-explorer.md), you can create a chart of **Authenticated Users** and **Accounts**.

trans-unit.source: Set defaults for selected custom telemetry
trans-unit.target: Set defaults for selected custom telemetry

trans-unit.source: If you just want to set default property values for some of the custom events that you write, you can set them in a TelemetryClient.
trans-unit.target: If you just want to set default property values for some of the custom events that you write, you can set them in a TelemetryClient.

trans-unit.source: They are attached to every telemetry item sent from that client.
trans-unit.target: They are attached to every telemetry item sent from that client.

trans-unit.source: C
trans-unit.target: C

trans-unit.source: VB
trans-unit.target: VB

trans-unit.source: Java
trans-unit.target: Java

trans-unit.source: Individual telemetry calls can override the default values in their property dictionaries.
trans-unit.target: Individual telemetry calls can override the default values in their property dictionaries.

trans-unit.source: **For JavaScript web clients**, [use JavaScript telemetry initializers](#js-initializer).
trans-unit.target: **For JavaScript web clients**, [use JavaScript telemetry initializers](#js-initializer).

trans-unit.source: Set the instrumentation key for selected custom telemetry
trans-unit.target: Set the instrumentation key for selected custom telemetry

trans-unit.source: C
trans-unit.target: C

trans-unit.source: Telemetry Initializers
trans-unit.target: Telemetry Initializers

trans-unit.source: Use telemetry initializers to define global properties that are sent with all telemetry; and to override selected behavior of the standard telemetry modules.
trans-unit.target: Use telemetry initializers to define global properties that are sent with all telemetry; and to override selected behavior of the standard telemetry modules.

trans-unit.source: For example, the Application Insights for Web package collects telemetry about HTTP requests.
trans-unit.target: For example, the Application Insights for Web package collects telemetry about HTTP requests.

trans-unit.source: By default, it flags as failed any request with a response code >= 400.
trans-unit.target: By default, it flags as failed any request with a response code >= 400.

trans-unit.source: But if you want to treat 400 as a success, you can provide a telemetry initilizer that sets the Success property.
trans-unit.target: But if you want to treat 400 as a success, you can provide a telemetry initilizer that sets the Success property.

trans-unit.source: If you provide a telemetry initializer, it is called whenever any of the Track*() methods is called.
trans-unit.target: If you provide a telemetry initializer, it is called whenever any of the Track*() methods is called.

trans-unit.source: This includes methods called by the standard telemetry modules.
trans-unit.target: This includes methods called by the standard telemetry modules.

trans-unit.source: By convention, these modules do not set any property that has already been set by an initializer.
trans-unit.target: By convention, these modules do not set any property that has already been set by an initializer.

trans-unit.source: Define your initializer
trans-unit.target: Define your initializer

trans-unit.source: C
trans-unit.target: C

trans-unit.source: Load your initializer
trans-unit.target: Load your initializer

trans-unit.source: In ApplicationInsights.config:
trans-unit.target: In ApplicationInsights.config:

trans-unit.source: *Alternatively,* you can instantiate the initializer in code, for example in Global.aspx.cs:
trans-unit.target: *Alternatively,* you can instantiate the initializer in code, for example in Global.aspx.cs:

trans-unit.source: See more of this sample.
trans-unit.target: See more of this sample.

trans-unit.source: JavaScript telemetry initializers
trans-unit.target: JavaScript telemetry initializers

trans-unit.source: JavaScript
trans-unit.target: JavaScript

trans-unit.source: Insert a telemetry initializer immediately after the initialization code that you got from the portal:
trans-unit.target: Insert a telemetry initializer immediately after the initialization code that you got from the portal:

trans-unit.source: For a summary of the non-custom properties available on the telemetryItem, see the [data model](app-insights-export-data-model.md/#lttelemetrytypegt).
trans-unit.target: For a summary of the non-custom properties available on the telemetryItem, see the [data model](app-insights-export-data-model.md/#lttelemetrytypegt).

trans-unit.source: You can add as many initializers as you like.
trans-unit.target: You can add as many initializers as you like.

trans-unit.source: Dynamic instrumentation key
trans-unit.target: Dynamic instrumentation key

trans-unit.source: To avoid mixing up telemetry from development, test and production environments, you can [create separate Application Insights resources][create] and change their keys depending on the environment.
trans-unit.target: To avoid mixing up telemetry from development, test and production environments, you can [create separate Application Insights resources][create] and change their keys depending on the environment.

trans-unit.source: Instead of getting the instrumentation key from the configuration file, you can set it in your code.
trans-unit.target: Instead of getting the instrumentation key from the configuration file, you can set it in your code.

trans-unit.source: Set the key in an initialization method, such as global.aspx.cs in an ASP.NET service:
trans-unit.target: Set the key in an initialization method, such as global.aspx.cs in an ASP.NET service:

trans-unit.source: C
trans-unit.target: C

trans-unit.source: JavaScript
trans-unit.target: JavaScript

trans-unit.source: In web pages, you might want to set it from the web server's state, rather than coding it literally into the script.
trans-unit.target: In web pages, you might want to set it from the web server's state, rather than coding it literally into the script.

trans-unit.source: Flushing data
trans-unit.target: Flushing data

trans-unit.source: Normally the SDK sends data at times chosen to minimize impact on the user.
trans-unit.target: Normally the SDK sends data at times chosen to minimize impact on the user.

trans-unit.source: However, in some cases you might want to flush the buffer - for example, if you are using the SDK in an application that shuts down.
trans-unit.target: However, in some cases you might want to flush the buffer - for example, if you are using the SDK in an application that shuts down.

trans-unit.source: C
trans-unit.target: C

trans-unit.source: Note that the function is synchronous.
trans-unit.target: Note that the function is synchronous.

trans-unit.source: Disable standard telemetry
trans-unit.target: Disable standard telemetry

trans-unit.source: You can [disable selected parts of the standard telemetry][config] by editing `ApplicationInsights.config`.
trans-unit.target: You can [disable selected parts of the standard telemetry][config] by editing `ApplicationInsights.config`.

trans-unit.source: You could do this, for example, if you want to send your own TrackRequest data.
trans-unit.target: You could do this, for example, if you want to send your own TrackRequest data.

trans-unit.source: [Learn more][config].
trans-unit.target: [Learn more][config].

trans-unit.source: Developer mode
trans-unit.target: Developer mode

trans-unit.source: During debugging, it's useful to have your telemetry expedited through the pipeline so that you can see results immediately.
trans-unit.target: During debugging, it's useful to have your telemetry expedited through the pipeline so that you can see results immediately.

trans-unit.source: You also get additional messages that help you trace any problems with the telemetry.
trans-unit.target: You also get additional messages that help you trace any problems with the telemetry.

trans-unit.source: Switch it off in production, as it may slow down your app.
trans-unit.target: Switch it off in production, as it may slow down your app.

trans-unit.source: C
trans-unit.target: C

trans-unit.source: VB
trans-unit.target: VB

trans-unit.source: TelemetryContext
trans-unit.target: TelemetryContext

trans-unit.source: TelemetryClient has a Context property, which contains a number of values that are sent along with all telemetry data.
trans-unit.target: TelemetryClient has a Context property, which contains a number of values that are sent along with all telemetry data.

trans-unit.source: They are normally set by the standard telemetry modules, but you can also set them yourself.
trans-unit.target: They are normally set by the standard telemetry modules, but you can also set them yourself.

trans-unit.source: For example:
trans-unit.target: For example:

trans-unit.source: If you set any of these values yourself, consider removing the relevant line from [ApplicationInsights.config][config], so that your values and the standard values don't get confused.
trans-unit.target: If you set any of these values yourself, consider removing the relevant line from [ApplicationInsights.config][config], so that your values and the standard values don't get confused.

trans-unit.source: **Component** Identifies the app and its version
trans-unit.target: **Component** Identifies the app and its version

trans-unit.source: **Device** Data about the device on which the app is running (in web apps, this is the server or client device from which the telemetry is sent)
trans-unit.target: **Device** Data about the device on which the app is running (in web apps, this is the server or client device from which the telemetry is sent)

trans-unit.source: **InstrumentationKey** Identifies the Application Insights resource in Azure where the telemetry will appear.
trans-unit.target: **InstrumentationKey** Identifies the Application Insights resource in Azure where the telemetry will appear.

trans-unit.source: Usually picked up from ApplicationInsights.config
trans-unit.target: Usually picked up from ApplicationInsights.config

trans-unit.source: **Location** Identifies the geographic location of the device.
trans-unit.target: **Location** Identifies the geographic location of the device.

trans-unit.source: **Operation** In web apps, the current HTTP request.
trans-unit.target: **Operation** In web apps, the current HTTP request.

trans-unit.source: In other app types, you can set this to group events together.
trans-unit.target: In other app types, you can set this to group events together.

trans-unit.source: **Id**: A generated value that correlates different events, so that when you inspect any event in Diagnostic Search, you can find "Related items"
trans-unit.target: **Id**: A generated value that correlates different events, so that when you inspect any event in Diagnostic Search, you can find "Related items"

trans-unit.source: **Name**: An identifier, usually the URL of the HTTP request.
trans-unit.target: **Name**: An identifier, usually the URL of the HTTP request.

trans-unit.source: **SyntheticSource**: If not null or empty, this string indicates that the source of the request has been identified as a robot or web test.
trans-unit.target: **SyntheticSource**: If not null or empty, this string indicates that the source of the request has been identified as a robot or web test.

trans-unit.source: By default it will be excluded from calculations in Metrics Explorer.
trans-unit.target: By default it will be excluded from calculations in Metrics Explorer.

trans-unit.source: **Properties** Properties that are sent with all telemetry data.
trans-unit.target: **Properties** Properties that are sent with all telemetry data.

trans-unit.source: Can be overridden in individual Track* calls.
trans-unit.target: Can be overridden in individual Track* calls.

trans-unit.source: **Session** Identifies the user's session.
trans-unit.target: **Session** Identifies the user's session.

trans-unit.source: The Id is set to a generated value, which is changed when the user has not been active for a while.
trans-unit.target: The Id is set to a generated value, which is changed when the user has not been active for a while.

trans-unit.source: **User** User information.
trans-unit.target: **User** User information.

trans-unit.source: Context initializers - Set default properties for all telemetry
trans-unit.target: Context initializers - Set default properties for all telemetry

trans-unit.source: You can set up a universal initializer so that all new TelemetryClients automatically use your context.
trans-unit.target: You can set up a universal initializer so that all new TelemetryClients automatically use your context.

trans-unit.source: This includes standard telemetry sent by the platform-specific telemetry modules, such as web server request tracking.
trans-unit.target: This includes standard telemetry sent by the platform-specific telemetry modules, such as web server request tracking.

trans-unit.source: A typical use is to identify telemetry coming from different versions or components of your app.
trans-unit.target: A typical use is to identify telemetry coming from different versions or components of your app.

trans-unit.source: In the portal, you can filter or group results by the "Application Version" property.
trans-unit.target: In the portal, you can filter or group results by the "Application Version" property.

trans-unit.source: In general, [we recommend that you use telemetry initializers rather than context initializers](http://apmtips.com/blog/2015/06/09/do-not-use-context-initializers/).
trans-unit.target: In general, [we recommend that you use telemetry initializers rather than context initializers](http://apmtips.com/blog/2015/06/09/do-not-use-context-initializers/).

trans-unit.source: Define a context initializer
trans-unit.target: Define a context initializer

trans-unit.source: Limits
trans-unit.target: Limits

trans-unit.source: There are some limits on the number of metrics and events per application.
trans-unit.target: There are some limits on the number of metrics and events per application.

trans-unit.source: Up to 500 telemetry data points per second per instrumentation key (that is, per application).
trans-unit.target: Up to 500 telemetry data points per second per instrumentation key (that is, per application).

trans-unit.source: This includes both the standard telemetry sent by the SDK modules, and custom events, metrics and other telemetry sent by your code.
trans-unit.target: This includes both the standard telemetry sent by the SDK modules, and custom events, metrics and other telemetry sent by your code.

trans-unit.source: Maximum of 200 unique metric names and 200 unique property names for your application.
trans-unit.target: Maximum of 200 unique metric names and 200 unique property names for your application.

trans-unit.source: Metrics include data send via TrackMetric as well as measurements on other data types such as Events.
trans-unit.target: Metrics include data send via TrackMetric as well as measurements on other data types such as Events.

trans-unit.source: Metrics and property names are global per instrumentation key, not scoped to data type.
trans-unit.target: Metrics and property names are global per instrumentation key, not scoped to data type.

trans-unit.source: Properties can be used for filtering and group-by only while they have less than 100 unique values for each property.
trans-unit.target: Properties can be used for filtering and group-by only while they have less than 100 unique values for each property.

trans-unit.source: After the unique values exceed 100, the property can still be used for search and filtering but no longer for filters.
trans-unit.target: After the unique values exceed 100, the property can still be used for search and filtering but no longer for filters.

trans-unit.source: Standard properties such as Request Name and Page URL are limited to 1000 unique values per week.
trans-unit.target: Standard properties such as Request Name and Page URL are limited to 1000 unique values per week.

trans-unit.source: After 1000 unique values, additional values are marked as "Other values".
trans-unit.target: After 1000 unique values, additional values are marked as "Other values".

trans-unit.source: The original value can still be used for full text search and filtering.
trans-unit.target: The original value can still be used for full text search and filtering.

trans-unit.source: Q: How long is data kept?
trans-unit.target: Q: How long is data kept?

trans-unit.source: See [Data retention and privacy][data].
trans-unit.target: See [Data retention and privacy][data].

trans-unit.source: What exceptions might Track_() calls throw?
trans-unit.target: What exceptions might Track_() calls throw?

trans-unit.source: None.
trans-unit.target: None.

trans-unit.source: You don't need to wrap them in try-catch clauses.
trans-unit.target: You don't need to wrap them in try-catch clauses.

trans-unit.source: If the SDK encounters problems, it will log messages that you will see in the debug console output, and - if the messages get through - in diagnostic search.
trans-unit.target: If the SDK encounters problems, it will log messages that you will see in the debug console output, and - if the messages get through - in diagnostic search.

trans-unit.source: Is there a REST API?
trans-unit.target: Is there a REST API?

trans-unit.source: Yes, but we aren't publishing it yet.
trans-unit.target: Yes, but we aren't publishing it yet.
